page.title: 08EARLSHALL CASTLE
page.content: On the outskirts of Leuchars is a magnificent 16th century castle called Earlshall. The present owners, Major and Mrs Baxter, have opened 10 of the 30 rooms to the public, and last year had 4,000 visitors. Special features inculde; a display of over 100 basket -hilted swords in the Long Gallery; a small museum; a rod and gun room; a collection of mugs and Jacobite glasses; some beautiful wood panelling and a famous oak screen. Most of the rooms have wooden ceilings, beams exposed and beautifully painted with coats of arms and patterns. Mary Queen of Scots visited the castle on a hunting trip and there is a room dedicated to her. The castle has a large formal garden which includes Yews shaped liked chessmen, the old castle well and orchard and extensive grounds.
